subject: Law
title: Roe, Dobbs, and Reproductive Rights
description: A quick, practical guide to Roe, Dobbs, and Reproductive Rights.

hook.text: For nearly fifty years, Roe v. Wade protected abortion rights. In 2022, the Supreme Court overturned it.

buildup.text: Roe (1973) found a constitutional right to privacy that included the decision to terminate a pregnancy.

discovery.text: Dobbs v. Jackson (2022) ruled that no such right exists in the Constitution's text or history.

twist.text: The decision didn't ban abortion. It returned the question to individual states, creating a patchwork of laws.

climax.text: Dobbs reignited debate about which rights are 'fundamental' even when not explicitly listed.

quiz.question: What did Dobbs v. Jackson do?
options: Overturned Roe and returned the issue to states
